Result.Abstract: This paper is the latest in a short series on the origins, processes and effects of performativity in the public sector. Performativity, it is argued, is a new mode of state regulation which makes it possible to govern in an 'advanced lib- eral' way. It requires individual practitioners to organize themselves as a response to targets, indicators and evalua- tions.

Result.Title: Policy Sociology and Critical Social Research: a personal review of recent education policy and policy research

Result.Abstract: Parental choice is one of the keystones of current education policy in the UK. Result.Title: School choice, social class and distinction: the realization of social advantage in education

Result.Title: ’I Heard It on the Grapevine’: ‘hot’ knowledge and school choice

Result.Title: Labour, Learning and the Economy: a ‘policy sociology’ perspective

Result.Abstract: The role of the researcher's self and social relations in the construction of the ethnographic fieldwork experience is considered. Result.Title: Self‐doubt and soft data: social and technical trajectories in ethnographic fieldwork

Result.Title: Making a Difference?: Institutional Habituses and Higher Education Choice

Result.Title: ‘Making their Minds Up’: family dynamics of school choice

Result.Title: Captured by the Discourse? Issues and concerns in researching ‘parental choice‘

Result.Title: `Making Up' the Middle-Class Child: Families, Activities and Class Dispositions

Result.Title: The social geography of childcare: making up a middle‐class child

Result.Title: Whose ‘learning’ society? A tentative deconstruction

Result.Title: Education, Majorism and ‘the Curriculum of the Dead’

Result.Title: Some reflections on policy theory: a brief response to Hatcher and Troyna

Result.Title: Policy enactments in the UK secondary school: examining policy, practice and school positioning

Result.Title: Values and Ethics in the Education Market Place: the case of Northwark Park

Result.Title: The Legacy of ERA, Privatization and the Policy Ratchet

Result.Title: Essentials of Female ManagementWomen’s Ways of Working in the Education Market Place?

Result.Abstract: Choice of school remains a hot topic in UK educational politics. Result.Title: Urban education, the middle classes and their dilemmas of school choice

Result.Title: Is Research Possible? A rejoinder to Tooley's ‘On School Choice and Social Class‘

Result.Title: Markets, inequality, and urban schooling
